III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Communication
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4124
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a written policy regarding
Description communication that ensures that a child is able to communicate
with family and friends in a manner appropriate to the child’s
functioning and consistent with the child’s treatment plan and
security level.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth are being withheld from communication with family, friends,
and public.
Investigation This complaint was received on 03/12/2024 via the online agency
complaint platform.
I attempted to contact Complainant via email on 03/12/2024, and
they did not respond to the email.
I interviewed Director at the agency on 03/12/2024. Director
reported all the youths are allowed to call family members and
their workers with staff supervision. He is not aware of any reports
or complaints regarding youths not being able to call family
members.
I interviewed Youth A at the agency on 03/12/2024. Youth A reported
that staff allow him to use the agency phone and call his Foster Care
Worker and family members. He said staff have to provide
supervision when he makes phone calls.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the agency on 03/12/2024. Staff 1 reported all
youths are allowed to make phone calls if a staff member is available
to supervise the calls. Youths are allowed to contact anyone on their
approved contact logs. He said staff never denied the youths request
to use the phones.
I interviewed Youth B at the agency on 03/14/2024. Youth B has
been at the agency for one year. Youth B reported he calls his
grandfather every day. He said staff supervise his calls. Youth B said
staff never deny him access to calling his family.
I interviewed Youth C at the agency on 03/14/2024. Youth B has
been at the agency for one year. Youth B reported he calls his mother
2

every day. Youth C said staff never deny him the use of the
telephone. Youth C expressed no concerns regarding staff or the
agency.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the agency on 03/14/2024. Supervisor
1 reported the agency allows the youths to make phone calls to family
members and workers anytime, as long as a staff member is
available to supervise the calls. He is not aware of any incident where
staff denied youths calls with family members.
Documentation Review:
• Agency policy for family services: The agency with each
child’s individual Treatment Plan, offer flexible hours to
meet the family’s time schedule and provide an identifiable
area for family visits that offer privacy, security, and
comfort. Family involvement is highly encouraged and
includes monthly family forums; monthly family
psychoeducation groups and family support groups located
on our campus. Services offered to family members include
visitation, monthly case conferences, family phone calls,
and family therapy and family fun events.
Analysis There is no evidence to support the allegation that the agency is
not allowing the youths to communicate with family members. All
youth reported staff allow them to call family members.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Recreational activities, equipment, and supplies; swimming
Title restriction.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4136
Section (2) Residents shall be provided a variety of indoor and outdoor
Description recreational activities designed to meet the residents’ needs.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth are not allowed to have bikes; teenagers are not able to go
to the library or local government recreation centers.
Investigation
I interviewed Director on 03/12/2024 at the agency. Director
reported they have approximately 30 bikes currently stored in the
basement for the winter. He said youths are provided bikes and
scooters, but they are currently stored away for the winter.
Director reported the agency provides off site activities, daily gym
and outside activities, video games, board games, and television.
Director provided a copy of the event and activity schedule.
3

Director provided access to the basement in the administrator
building were bikes and scooters are stored. I observed
approximately 30 bikes and scooters in the basement.
I interviewed Youth A on 03/12/2024. Youth A has been at the
agency for 6 months. Youth A reported he participates in daily
activities at the gym, and he plays video games and board games
in the cottage. He said staff take the youths offsite to the park,
library, movies, and to the arcade center. Youth A said the staff
also take them to the store when they want to buy things. Youth A
said the agency also will provide special activities around the
different holidays.
I interviewed Youth B on 03/14/2024. Youth B has been at the
agency for one year. Youth B reported the agency does have
bikes, scooters, and provides off site activities. He said staff take
them to the park, arcade, store, and they have birthday and
holiday events.
I interviewed Youth C on 03/14/2024. Youth C has been at the
agency for one year. Youth C reported the agency has bikes they
use in the summer. Youth C said staff take them to the park,
arcade, mall, and movies. Youth C said they also go to the gym
and play basketball on the playground outside the cottages.
Documents Reviewed:
• Event and Activity schedule:
1. 04/07/2024- Church event
2. 04/08/2024- Park event
3. 04/09/2024- Park/five below/Slurpee Run
4. 04/10/2024- Karate class
5. 04/11/2024- Arcade
6. 04/13/2024- Cooking class
7. 04/13/2024- Birthday club event
8. 04/13/2024- Mentoring outing
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule based on interviews with
Staff and Youths. The agency provides daily activities onsite and
off-site.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Electrical service
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4615
Section (1) The electrical service shall be maintained in a safe condition.
Description
4

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There was no electricity in a few of the buildings.
Investigation
I interviewed Director on 03/12/2024 at the agency and he
reported all the buildings on the campus have working electricity.
Director has been working at the agency for over one year and is
not aware of any time the agency didn’t not have working
electricity.
I interviewed Staff 1 on 03/12/2024 at the agency. Staff 1 reported
all the buildings have working electricity and he is not aware of
any time that they didn’t have electricity.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 03/14/2024 at the agency.
Supervisor 1 reported he is not aware of any time where the
agency did not have working electricity.
I interviewed Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C on 03/12/2024 at
the agency. Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C reported they have
working electricity in the cottages, gym, and therapy office.
Tour Observation:
I completed a walk-through the agency on 03/12/2024 and
03/14/2024. I observed the two cottages, administrative building,
and kitchen area and all they all had working electricity.
Analysis There is no evidence to support the allegation that there is no
electricity in some of the buildings, based on interviews with Staff
and Youths. A walk through was completed and all buildings had
working electricity.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
